bill.title: Adoption Records; Open Access
bill.description: Allows adopted individuals who have attained eighteen years of age, adoptive parents, and natural parents unfettered access to the adopted individual's sealed adoption records. (SD1)

history.action: Pending introduction.
Introduced and Pass First Reading.
Referred to HLT, JUD, referral sheet 2
Bill scheduled to be heard by HLT on Friday, 02-12-16 8:30AM in House conference room 329.
Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

The committees on HLT recommend that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes were as follows: 7 Ayes: Representative(s) Belatti, Creagan, Hashem, Jordan, Kobayashi, Morikawa; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) Oshiro; Noes: none; and 2 Excused: Representative(s) Fukumoto Chang, Tupola.
Reported from HLT (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 427-16) as amended in HD 1, recommending passage on Second Reading and referral to JUD.

Passed Second Reading as amended in HD 1 and referred to the committee(s) on JUD with Representative(s) Har voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Luke, Nakashima, Souki excused (3).
Bill scheduled to be heard by JUD on Tuesday, 02-23-16 2:00PM in House conference room 325.
Broadcast of hearing/briefing available. See: www.capitoltv.org

The committees on JUD recommend that the measure be PASSED, UNAMENDED. The votes were as follows: 13 Ayes: Representative(s) Rhoads, Belatti, Brower, Creagan, Hashem, Kawakami, C. Lee, Morikawa, Nakashima, Takayama, McDermott, Thielen; Ayes with reservations: Representative(s) San Buenaventura; Noes: none; and 1 Excused: Representative(s) Woodson.
Reported from JUD (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 698-16), recommending passage on Third Reading.
Passed Third Reading with Representative(s) Har, San Buenaventura, Ward voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Kong, Saiki, Tupola excused (3). Transmitted to Senate.
Received from House (Hse. Com. No. 28).
Passed First Reading.
Referred to JDL.
The committee(s) on JDL has scheduled a public hearing on 03-23-16 9:00AM in conference room 016.

The committee(s) on JDL recommend(s) that the measure be PASSED, WITH AMENDMENTS. The votes in JDL were as follows: 6 Aye(s): Senator(s) Keith-Agaran, Shimabukuro, Gabbard, Kim, L. Thielen, Slom; Aye(s) with reservations: none ; 0 No(es): none; and 1 Excused: Senator(s) K.Kahele.
Reported from JDL (Stand. Com. Rep. No. 3302) with recommendation of passage on Second Reading, as amended (SD 1) and placement on the calendar for Third Reading.
Report adopted; Passed Second Reading, as amended (SD 1).
48 Hrs. Notice 04-06-16.
Passed Third Reading, as amended (SD 1). Ayes, 23; Aye(s) with reservations: none . Noes, 0 (none). Excused, 2 (Senator(s) Slom, L. Thielen). Transmitted to House.
Returned from Senate (Sen. Com. No. 414) in amended form (SD 1).
House disagrees with Senate amendment (s).
Received notice of disagreement (Hse. Com. No. 392).
Senate Conferees Appointed: Keith-Agaran Chair; Gabbard, Shimabukuro.
Received notice of Senate conferees (Sen. Com. No. 652).
Reconsideration of action taken on 04-07-16.
Received notice of House reconsideration of action in disagreeing to the amendments proposed by the Senate (Hse. Com. No. 632).
House agrees to Senate amendment(s).
Passed Final Reading as amended in SD 1 with none voting aye with reservations; none voting no (0) and Representative(s) Ing, Oshiro excused (2).
Received notice of House agreement and passage on Final Reading (Hse. Com. No. 658).
Transmitted to Governor.
